alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 2:48PM CST until January 28 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Conroe affecting Montgomery County. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Conroe. * WHEN...From late tonight to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 117.8 feet, Major lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 109.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 113.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 118.2 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 115.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 118.0 feet on 05/22/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat West Fork San Jacinto Conroe 115.8 109.2 Wed 2 pm CST 118.1 117.4 116.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 900 AM CST.
